Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label different plants and animals, including a fish, in their natural environment.
The student can represent and label the habitat where the fish lives, such as a lake, river, pond, or ocean.
The student can include and label elements that fish need to survive, like water and air.
The student can identify and show the relationship between the fish and its habitat, explaining that fish need water to swim and live.
The student can illustrate how fish and other plants and animals relate to the resources available in their environment.
The student can demonstrate how different parts of the habitat system, such as water and plants, work together to meet the needs of the fish.
